org.jcatapult.freemarker
Class DefaultFreeMarkerService

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.freemarker.DefaultFreeMarkerService
All Implemented Interfaces:
FreeMarkerService
public class DefaultFreeMarkerService
extends Object
implements FreeMarkerService

This is a simple FreeMarkerService implementation. It uses two configuration parameters and the OverridingTemplateLoader to provide FreeMarker rendering capabiilities.

Caching

By default, FreeMarker provides caching for all templates. This class uses that caching by default as well. However, you can also change this class to not cache at all by setting the check seconds to a negative number.

NOTE If you set the check seconds to a negative number, the templates are still cached but just reloaded each time. This will incur memory a penalty.

The configuration parameters are:

jcatapult.freemarker-service.check-seconds
An integer that controls the number of seconds that the templates are checked for new versions. If you don't specify this configuration parameter a default is determined. The way that this is determine is based on the environment. If the environment is production, this returns Integer.MAX_VALUE. Otherwise it returns 2. Therefore, the templates are reloaded quite frequently in development but never reloaded in production.

Author:
Brian Pontarelli

Method Detail

render

public String render(String templateName,
                     Object root,
                     Locale locale)
              throws FreeMarkerRenderException,
                     MissingTemplateException
Renders the given template. This method renders the template into a StringWriter and then returns the String.

Specified by:
render in interface FreeMarkerService
Parameters:
templateName - The name of the template. Since this service is generic, this is the full path to the template. For example, it would be /WEB-INF/emails/foo-html.ftl.
root - This can be a Map or a FreeMarker model type that provides the values to the template.
locale - The locale used to find the template.
Returns:
The template.
Throws:
FreeMarkerRenderException - If the render fails.
MissingTemplateException - If the template is missing.

render

public void render(Writer writer,
                   String templateName,
                   Object root,
                   Locale locale)
            throws FreeMarkerRenderException,
                   MissingTemplateException
Renders the given template. This method renders the template into the given Writer.

Specified by:
render in interface FreeMarkerService
Parameters:
writer - The writer to output the render to.
templateName - The name of the template. Since this service is generic, this is the full path to the template. For example, it would be /WEB-INF/emails/foo-html.ftl.
root - This can be a Map or a FreeMarker model type that provides the values to the template.
locale - The locale used to find the template.
Throws:
FreeMarkerRenderException - If the render fails.
MissingTemplateException - If the template is missing.
